metadata.title: CVE-2017-11188 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The ReadDPXImage function in coders\dpx.c in ImageMagick 7.0.6-0 has alarge loop vulnerability that can cause CPU exhaustion via a crafted DPXfile, related to lack of an EOF check.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11188` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8').
